name: St. Cyriacus
summary: Cyriacus was a deacon and one of the most venerated martyrs of Rome. According to tradition, he was a deacon who was known for his charity and service to the poor. He was martyred during the Diocletian persecution along with his companions Largus and Smaragdus. He is the patron saint of deacons and is often invoked for protection against temptation.
